1.text: For behold, the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, will take away from Jerusalem and from Judah stay and staff, the whole stay of bread, and the whole stay of water,

2.text: the mighty man and the man of war, the judge and the prophet, and the diviner and the elder,

3.text: the captain of fifty, and the honourable man, and the counsellor, and the clever among artificers, and the one versed in enchantments.

4.text: And I will appoint youths as their princes, and children shall rule over them.

5.text: And the people shall be oppressed one by the other, and each by his neighbour; the child will be insolent against the elder, and the base against the honourable.

6.text: When a man shall take hold of his brother, in his fatherâ€™s house, [and shall say:] Thou hast clothing; be our chief, and let this ruin be under thy hand;

7.text: he will lift up [his hand] in that day, saying, I cannot be a healer, and in my house there is neither bread nor clothing; ye shall not make me a chief of the people.

8.text: For Jerusalem stumbleth and Judah falleth, because their tongue and their doings are against Jehovah, to provoke the eyes of his glory.

9.text: The look of their face doth witness against them, and they declare their sin as Sodom: they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have brought evil upon themselves.

10.text: Say ye of the righteous that it shall be well [with him], for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.

11.text: Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill [with him], because the desert of his hands shall be rendered unto him.

12.text: [As for] my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. My people! they that guide thee mislead [thee], and destroy the way of thy paths.

13.text: Jehovah setteth himself to plead, and standeth to judge the peoples.

14.text: Jehovah will enter into judgment with the elders of his people and their princes, [saying:] It is ye that have eaten up the vineyard: the spoil of the poor is in your houses.

15.text: What mean ye that ye crush my people, and grind the faces of the afflicted? saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts.

16.text: And Jehovah said, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched-out neck and wanton eyes, and go along mincing, and making a tinkling with their feet;

17.text: therefore the Lord will make bald the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and Jehovah will lay bare their secret parts.

18.text: In that day the Lord will take away the ornament of anklets, and the little suns and crescents,

19.text: the pearl-drops, and the bracelets, and the veils,

20.text: the head-dresses, and the stepping chains, and the girdles, and the scent-boxes, and the amulets;

22.text: the festival-robes, and the tunics, and the mantles, and the wallets;

23.text: the mirrors, and the fine linen bodices, and the turbans, and the flowing veils.

24.text: And it shall come to pass, instead of perfume there shall be rottenness; and instead of a girdle, a rope; and instead of well-set hair, baldness; and instead of a robe of display, a girding of sackcloth; brand instead of beauty.

25.text: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the fight;

26.text: and her gates shall lament and mourn; and, stripped, she shall sit upon the ground.
